hackathon-description-text: Like to write programs? Dig into interesting datasets? Design creative works? Or maybe you’ve never written a line of code? We will provide the space and the resources for you to express your creativity, ingenuity, and determination to create anything you want to. Whether you’re building your first website, dabbling in Photoshop, or hacking with an Oculus Rift, HackCU is for you. HackCU is for people of all backgrounds and experiences. So, come and join us!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Leeds School of Business Burridge Center for Finance

hackathon-eligibility: Any student, 18 or older, is welcome to apply!
hackathon-rules:
You can find a detailed code of conduct 
. All participants are required to adhere to the same.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Backpack filled with swag and goodies (WD 1TB Hard Drive, Anker portable charger, Anker Soundcore 2, GitHub promo codes, stickers and more!)
GitHub Coupons for all team members
Competition on who can make the best and most innovative NEO Dapp. All documentation and support will be provided by two NEO lead developers.
Create an application to process remote sensor data from a hypothetical edge environment.

utonomous systems, like drones, self-driving cars, and submersibles, are taking on new importance every day, and we want to see your ideas for the future. Build the best hack involving an unmanned system - land, sea, or air. Build the best hack involving an unmanned system - land, sea, or air - and win $500 in Amazon gift cards for your team.
Sentiment Analysis Challenge - Students should find correlations between societal/emotional trends and financial trends.

What's the attendance of a specific event? Hackers will be given an unexplained data set and will need to get through a series of different challenges, in Alteryx, to determine a specific event that they will need to tell us the attendance of.
Best hack that uses Twitter's Public API. Prize: Special Twitter Swag
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Twitter - Best use of Public API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Tracking assets with sticker labels enabling GPS and connectivity through wireless now, and develop the project further to use NB-IOT. Winners get a certificate for free Sling TV. Winners also get to present their idea to the executives at Dish Network. More information at

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=4001 Discovery Dr, Boulder, CO 80303, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How technically impressive was the hack?
How intuitive is the user interface and experience?
How complete is the hack and was the team able to accomplish what they wanted to achieve?
How much did the team stretch themselves to learn something new?

hackathon-location-description: University of Colorado Boulder - Sustainability, Energy and Environment Community (SEEC)
